results.title: Our melancholy duty
results.creator_credit: Peter Butt, Bee Reynolds, Will Davies and Look Television Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “When the war came to Australia”.
Although Australians rushed to support Britain in her war with Germany, it was not until Tobruk that Australians at home really cared about the war, and not until Dunkirk that they took Hitler seriously. Mothers and wives left at home take up the traditional supporting roles and the Women’s Services are formed, but soon the daily casualty lists begin to appear and the heartbreak and dread begin. Personal recollections, rare archival footage and the music of the time combine to create an evocative and haunting picture of this unique period in Australia’s history.

results.title: Scarfies [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Sarkis, Lisa Chatfield and Nightmare Productions
results.brief_description: A young group of Scarfies (local slang for students at Otago University, Dunedin) move into a squat but get more than they bargain for after discovering a crop of marijuana in the basement. Their initial exuberance gives way to panic when the owner returns for his crop. The group lock him into the basement while they figure out what to do. Starting as a light comedy, “Scarfies” shifts a gear and becomes increasingly black, resulting in a nightmarish thriller where the central characters’ morale and logic having fallen apart give way to desperate behaviour. Cast includes: Willa O’Neill, Neill Rea, Ashleigh Seagar, Taika Cohen, Charlie Bleakley, John Brazier, Mark Neilson and Mark Dudfield.

results.title: SBS Insight: millennium bug
results.creator_credit: Tatjana Djamin and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Just when we thought technology was under control the millennium bug fear sent shockwaves throughout the world with repercussions from PC’s to computers controlling aircraft and technical hospital equipment. The computer glitch known as the millennium bug threatened to come into being if all computers weren’t made compliant by the December 31st deadline. This episode of “Insight” looks at the crisis facing airlines and, in particular, Ansett’s strategy management of the problem. It looks at the financial cost of compliance, the formation of the millennium taskforce and the legal ramifications. Explains why technology failed us and an anthropologist, minister and historian thrash out millennium fears - which proves quite interesting in hindsight. Originally screened 28 May 1998.

results.title: Saw sense
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns, John Honey and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A chainsaw safety film aimed at both the professional and domestic user. The film is presented by a professional chainsaw operator, Robert Young, an employee of the Hobart City Council’s Mountain Maintenance gang. During a weekend firewood gathering trip, Robert takes us through the basic points of chainsaw safety.

results.title: Saving the environment: the garbage explosion
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A rapidly growing economy is producing equally rapid environmental pollution, with the vast increase in waste materials. The nature, volume and composition of wastes are investigated. The film presents advantages and disadvantages of current disposal methods and shows possible long range solutions.

results.title: Saving Private Ryan
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Gary Levinsohn, Ian Bryce, Mark Gordon, Amblin Entertainment, Mutual, NBCUniversal and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Beginning with a brutal re-enactment of the historic D-Day invasion on Omaha, Steven Spielberg’s graphically violent World War two drama follows a group of seven American soldiers who are sent on a secret mission behind enemy lines to find a soldier missing in action. Captain John Miller (Tom Hanks) heads the group of war weary men chosen to find Private James Ryan (Matt Damon), whose three brothers have been tragically killed in combat. Aside from the harrowing battle sequences (brilliantly shot by cinematographer Janusz Kaminski) which fully realise the horrors and waste of war, Spielberg’s attempt at asking complex questions about human nature, is confused at times and morally simplistic at others. Cast includes Tom Sizemore, Edward Burns, Vin Diesel, Jeremy Davies, Giovanni Ribisi, Barry Pepper, Adam Goldberg, Ted Danson and Dennis Farina (Awards: Winner of five 1998 Academy Awards including Best Director, Steven Spielberg, Best Cinematographer, Janusz Kaminski, Best Film Editing, Michael Kahn)

results.title: Schindler: the list of life
results.creator_credit: Ted Newsome, Ray Atherton and Wavelength Video Production
results.brief_description: Oskar Schindler was not the “stuff from which heroes are made”. A womaniser, opportunistic, charming and hedonistic this documentary examines Schindler’s life in terms of the historical events which shaped it: the rise of Nazism, the “Final Solution” and the Concentration Camps. His famous list of “essential” Jewish workers needed to staff his factory in order to help the Nazi war effort, ensured that the lives of 1,100 men, women and children were spared from the Holocaust atrocities. Schindler’s life ended tragically as he died alone and unsung. His request to be buried in Israel was met, and it is there that he is celebrated as a national hero. As one of the survivors on the list said, “[Schindler] gave me what the Nazi’s took away from me… hope.”

results.title: Scary movie [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Keenen Ivory Wayans, Eric Gold, Lee Mayes and Dimension Pictures
results.brief_description: The popularity of teenage slasher films in the 1980’s and 1990’s including ‘I Know What You Did Last Summer ‘, ‘Halloween’ and the ‘Scream’ trilogy lead to this parody film directed by Keenen Ivory Wayans. Ray, Brenda, Buffy, Shorty, Ray, Greg, Bobby and Cindy are on the run from a serial killer, seeking his revenge after the kids run him over following their school prom. Also causing problems for the ditzy teens are a nosy reporter Gail Hailstorm, assistant police officer Doofy and high school principal, Squiggly. Incidentally, ‘Scary Movie’ was the working title for the original ‘Scream’ film. Cast includes Marlon Wayans, Shawn Wayans, Shannon Elizabeth, Regina Hall, Lochlyn Munro, Anna Faris and Jon Abrahams.

results.title: Santa sangre (D)
results.creator_credit: Alejandro Jodorowsky, Claudio Argento and Intersound
results.brief_description: Like some Fellini-esque nightmare, this mix of circus freaks (tattooed lady, an exotic midget, sad faced clowns), bizarre religious imagery (an armless virgin saint, a cult of holy blood) and hallucinatory imagery (writhing snakes, zombie brides) abounds with disturbing psychological undercurrents. “A strange, violent but ultimately liberating vision.” - Time Out.

results.title: Santa Claus is coming tonight
results.creator_credit: Pierre Heberrt, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A combination of live-action footage and animation creates a film that is an effective reminder that Christmas is fast disappearing under a mountain of crass commercialism: Santa Clauses that operate on a tight time schedule, a landscape shorn of evergreens, a cornucopia of toys and gadgets, and a cacophony of noise. The story is biting, the drawings are pointed, and the feast of Christmas stands divested of its slick trappings.
